title: 2014: 40 Essential EPs From 2014 (Part II)
body:
### **[Part I](http://admin.

crackintheroad.com/music/30380-2014-40-essential-eps-2014-part) / [Part II](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/30394-2014-40-essential-eps-2014-part-ii) //// [Spotify Playlist](http://open.spotify.com/user/joshmdalton/playlist/7HBVYRZJp17Y3OMSuFjogw)** **Loyle Carner **– _A Little Late_ Emotionally charged six tracks from London rapper Loyle Carner, culminating in track of the year contender, Cantona. [Free download](http://www.loylecarner.com/) **Majid Jordan **– _A Place Like This_ Previous Drake collaborators stepped out from the shadows on their daringly slick EP release. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/a-place-like-this-ep/id894246532?wmgref=https%3A%2F%2Fsoundcloud.com%2F&ign-mpt=uo%3D4) **Marika Hackman ** – _Deaf Heat_ Her most complete, confident release to date and a fitting precursor to a forthcoming debut album. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/deaf-heat-ep/id828485268) **Movement **_– EP_ Extra slick R&B vibes from Australian trio Movement, drawing from D’Angelo and Jai Paul. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/movement-ep/id834814397) **Oceaan **– _The Grip_ His second EP release of 2014 proved his most ambitious, stepping away from the Ben Khan and Jai Paul grove into a sound entirely his own. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/the-grip-e.p/id933302880) / [Vinyl](http://www.thegenepool.co.uk/items/1432.htm) **Osca **– _Blood_ Stadium ready indie-pop from this young London quartet. Chris Martin, watch your back. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/blood-ep/id926964769) **Oyinda **– _Before The Fall_ One of my favourite tracks of the year (below), featuring on Oyinda’s emotionally fraught, sensual debut release. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/before-the-fall-ep/id939717149) **Palace **– _Lost In The Night_ Future indie kings Palace deservedly gained plaudits for their fantastic five track release. Some of the finest songwriting of the year. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/lost-in-the-night-ep/id897218271) **Panama Wedding **– _Parallel Play_ The absolute best pop songs of the year. Sing your heart out. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/parallel-play-ep/id874884212) **REID ** – _Fractures_ Another worthy contender for EP of the year. Switching effortlessly from upbeat dance numbers, to more foreboding, intimidating beats; an essential listen. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/fractures-ep/id895327517) **Ryn Weaver – **_Promises_ Pop’s newest star, fresh from writing with Charli XCX, Ryn Weaver’s Promises proved one of 2014’s most talked about releases. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/promises-ep/id903205627) **SALES **– _s/t_ A collection of tracks released over the course of the last year, SALES proved their songwriting abilities on their delightful self-titled EP. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/sales-ep/id921956424) **TALA **– _Alchemy_ The second of two EPs released by TALA in 2014, hinting at a more pop-orientated direction, whilst maintaining her unique, diverse style. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/alchemy-ep/id930858829) **Tenterhook **– _s/t_ Radio ready songwriting from the London teenager, expect even bigger singalongs in 2015. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/tenterhook-ep/id898235210) **To The Wedding **– _Silver Currents_ The most underrated release on this list, To The Wedding’s elegant, swirling, shoegaze inspired numbers more than earned her a place amongst the best. [Bandcamp](http://tothewedding.bandcamp.com/) **Vaults **– _Vultures_ Fulfilling early expectations with their most recent release, Vultures is a majestic triumph. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/vultures-ep/id933282690) **VERITE **_– Echo_ Impressed by the diversity of sound on Echo, the startlingly EP from NY’s pop starlet VERITE. iTunes **Vancouver Sleep Clinic **– _Winter_ Although making his name in 2013, VSC’s collection of Bon Iver inspired, ambient numbers appeared at the start of the year. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/winter-ep/id828459312) **Wolf Alice **– _Creature Songs_ A storming Glastonbury performance and several tours under their belts in 2014, their May EP showcased just why they’re all set to release one of 2015’s essential albums. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/creature-songs-ep/id859015269) **X Priest X **– _Samurai_ Florida duo X Priest X’s Samurai followed up 2013’s promising demos, and didn’t disappoint, with some of the most addictive pop songwriting around. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/samurai-ep/id846786987)
